article:
{{Infobox Museum |name = University of California Museum of Paleontology |image

Paleontology is located within the Valley Life Sciences Building |established =

The 'University of California Museum of Paleontology' ('UCMP') is a paleontology
museum located on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley.

The museum is within the 'Valley Life Sciences Building' (VLSB), designed by
George W. Kelham and completed in
1930 [http://berkeleyheritage.com/1967_UC_Berkeley_Buildings.html The
Centennial Record of the University of California] Helfland, Harvey.
2001. The Campus Guides: University of California Berkeley, p. 147 Its
collections are primarily intended for research and are thus not accessible to
the public. A limited number of fossils from the collection is on display in the
VLSB. Although located on the Berkeley campus, the museum is the
primary locality for storing fossils collected statewide. The original fossils,
around which the current collection has grown, were those gathered as part of
the California Geological Survey from 1860-1867.
